action.action-desc: Mrs. Gillibrand introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

form.official-title: To prohibit the sale or distribution of certain cosmetics containing synthetic plastic microbeads.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Microbead-Free Waters Act of 2014.

section.header: Prohibition against sale or distribution of certain cosmetics containing synthetic plastic microbeads

subsection.text: Section 601 of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 361) is amended by adding at the end the following:
If it is a cosmetic identified by the Secretary under section 2(c)(2) of the Microbead-Free Waters Act of 2014 and it contains synthetic plastic microbeads.
The amendment made by subsection (a) shall take effect on January 1, 2018.

Not later than January 1, 2017, the Secretary of Health and Human Services, acting through the Commissioner of Food and Drugs, shall promulgate a final rule that, for purposes of subsection (f) of section 601 of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (as added by subsection (a))â€”

paragraph.text: defines the term synthetic plastic microbead; and
identifies the cosmetics to which such subsection (f) shall apply.
